alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and western Texas, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Dona Ana. In western Texas, El Paso. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Franklin Mountains and West El Paso. Between 0.5 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Franklin Mountains and West El Paso is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Central El Paso, Sunland Park and Franklin Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
